application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1	Common Lime (Tilia x europaea)	Tree closest to Sudbrook Lane - using MEWP on road side - reduce spread over road by 2-3m and shape into remaining crown. FH  Unchanged 8m FS 6MRemove deadwood. T3	Common Lime (Tilia x europaea)	Tree opposite boundary between 210 Petersham Road (Gort Cottage) and 216 Petersham Road (Gort House) - using MEWP on road side - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by 2-3m. Final height 10m and spread 5m.Remove epicormic growth around base, remove Ivy and deadwood. Inspect crown and give verbal feedback. 		T4	Common Lime (Tilia x europaea)	Tree opposite Lamp post 223 - using MEWP on road side - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by 2-3m. Final height 10m and spread 5m.Remove epicormic growth around base, remove deadwood. Inspect crown and give verbal feedback. 			T5	Common Lime (Tilia x europaea)	Tree opposite entrance to 216 Petersham Road (Gort House) - using MEWP on road side - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by 2-3m. Final height 10m and spread 5m.Remove epicormic growth around base, remove deadwood. Inspect crown and give verbal feedback. 	T5	Common Lime (Tilia x europaea)	Tree opposite just south of entrance to 216 Petersham Road (Gort House) - using MEWP on road side - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by 2-3m. Final height 10m and spread 5m.  Remove epicormic growth around base, remove deadwood. Inspect crown and give verbal feedback. 		T6	Holm Oak - Evergreen Oak (Quercus ilex)	Tree near to side gate onto Sandpits Lane - using MEWP on road side - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by 2-3m. Final height 14m and spread 12m.  Remove deadwood. Inspect crown and give verbal feedback. 			T7	London plane (Platanus hispanica)	Tree opposite side of 173 Petersham Road (Mayleigh House) - Re-Pollard back to previous pollard points removing approximately 2-5m of new growth....
